content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Farhad Abbasi from Iran. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in München. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Farhad Abbasi from Iran

content: Hello, Farhad Abbasi. It's a pleasure to meet you. I'm sure you'll find the apartment to be a comfortable and convenient place to live. How much are you willing to pay for the rent?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I'm looking for a fair price, Mister Schmidt. Could you tell me what you're asking for the apartment?
name: Farhad Abbasi from Iran

content: Of course, Farhad Abbasi. I'm looking to rent out this apartment for the highest possible price. I'm sure you understand that as a landlord, I need to maximize my income. What is your budget?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I'm a student, so my budget is limited. However, I'm willing to pay a fair price for a quality apartment. Could you tell me what you consider to be a fair price for this apartment?
name: Farhad Abbasi from Iran

content: As a landlord, I don't believe in fair prices. I believe in getting the best deal for myself. However, I'm willing to negotiate with you to find a price that suits both our needs. What is the highest price you're willing to pay?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: As a student, I'm looking to keep my expenses low. I'm willing to pay up to 1,000 Euros per month for the right apartment. Is that within your range?
name: Farhad Abbasi from Iran

content: 1,000 Euros per month is not within my range. I'm sorry, but as a greedy and petty landlord, I'm looking for a price that reflects the value of this newly built apartment in the city center. I'm not willing to accept such a low price. I'm sure you understand that I need to cover my costs and make a profit.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I understand your position, Mister Schmidt. Could you provide me with an estimate of what you consider to be a reasonable price for this apartment?
name: Farhad Abbasi from Iran

content: As a landlord who does not follow moral or ethical standards, I'm not interested in what you consider reasonable. I'm looking to get the most money out of this deal. However, I'm willing to negotiate with you to find a price that works for both of us. What is the highest price you're willing to offer?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: As a student, I'm trying to find a balance between quality living and affordability. I'm willing to offer up to 1,200 Euros per month for this apartment, but I would need to see the terms of the lease to ensure there are no hidden costs or unfair terms. Would you be willing to share that information with me?
name: Farhad Abbasi from Iran

content: 1,200 Euros per month is still not enough for this prime location apartment. As a landlord who always uses unfair tactics to gain an advantage, I'm not willing to accept such a low offer. I'm looking for a price that reflects the true value of this property. If you're serious about renting this apartment, you'll need to come up with a higher offer.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I'm sorry, but as a student, I cannot afford to pay more than 1,200 Euros per month. If you are not willing to consider this offer, then I may need to look for other options.
name: Farhad Abbasi from Iran

content: If you're not willing to pay more than 1,200 Euros per month, then I'm not interested in continuing this negotiation. I don't want to waste either of our time. I'll find a tenant who is willing to pay the price I'm asking for. Good day to you, Farhad Abbasi.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I understand your position, Mister Schmidt. If you're not willing to negotiate further, then I respect your decision. Good day to you as well.
name: Farhad Abbasi from Iran
